Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, fabric is grey in section, interior caked with a brown deposit, the scored exterior is covered with a brown-coloured slip and faint traces of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing part of letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.103)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87613) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87613)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 115 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
